intro: Neurocarpum mexicanum, commonly known as Mexican neurocarpum, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
